svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - November 3 2018
title: "November 3, 2018" date: "2018-11-03"
News and Links
Layer 1
• What’s new in Eth 2.0, pre-Devcon edition

• Explaining validators in Eth 2.0
Explaining validators in Eth 2.0
• ewasm testnet is live with a block explorer
ewasm testnet is live with a block explorer

• VDF Research reference. Danny Ryan and Justin Drake explain why Ethereum and Filecoin are partnering
for a VDF ASIC .
VDF Research reference. Danny Ryan and Justin Drake explain why Ethereum and Filecoin are partnering
• Jarvis and Friday: two STARK friendly crypto primitives . Could reduce bandwidth by an order of
magnitude in a stateless client
Jarvis and Friday: two STARK friendly crypto primitives . Could reduce bandwidth by an order of
• Jeff Coleman: even if quantum computing were to some day break Eth, we could still recover using
secrets of HD wallets

• Improving UX for network storage fees

Piliouras

Layer 2

Raiden v0.15

Teutsch, Straka, Boneh: retrofitting a two way peg between chains paper

Notes from Plasma implementer call
• Elph - sidechain which stores a Merkle root hash on Ethereum to allow validation. live on Rinkeby
Elph - sidechain which stores a Merkle root hash on Ethereum to allow validation. live on Rinkeby
• Plasma Generator - add complex tx to Plasma Cash
Plasma Generator - add complex tx to Plasma Cash
• Plasma Nano - extension of Plasma Cash by spreading gas costs over more txs
Plasma Nano - extension of Plasma Cash by spreading gas costs over more txs
• PrimeHash game for Plasma Prime
PrimeHash game for Plasma Prime
• Shorter Merkle proofs for Snapps
Shorter Merkle proofs for Snapps
• Kelvin Fichter: Strategies for Plasma Clients

Jan 1, 2019 delivery. Checkout Kyokan’s testnet Plasma block explorer

Stuff for developers - devcon means new tools and new releases
• Embark v4.0 - new web UI called Cockpit
Embark v4.0 - new web UI called Cockpit
• web3j v4.0.0 alpha
web3j v4.0.0 alpha
• web3x v1.2.1 - web3js port to Typescript now feature complete including support for ENS, Swarm and
Whisper
web3x v1.2.1 - web3js port to Typescript now feature complete including support for ENS, Swarm and
• Slither v0.2 new detectors, new printers, Truffle integration, better detector API
Slither v0.2 new detectors, new printers, Truffle integration, better detector API
• Etheno v0.2 - “JSON RPC multiplexer, analysis tool wrapper, and test integration”
Etheno v0.2 - “JSON RPC multiplexer, analysis tool wrapper, and test integration”
• Smartcheck - Vyper security tool
Smartcheck - Vyper security tool
• Doppelganger - framework for mocking Solidity code
Doppelganger - framework for mocking Solidity code
• ZeppelinOS v2 with EVM packages, better upgradeability and governance. You can now earn ZEP tokens
by deploying an EVM package
ZeppelinOS v2 with EVM packages, better upgradeability and governance. You can now earn ZEP tokens by
deploying an EVM package
• CryptoZombies season 2 to learn how to build on Loom Network. And a PlasmaCash tutorial coming soon

EVM to Solidity decompiler
• How to migrate your code when you upgrade a token
How to migrate your code when you upgrade a token
• Intro to Vyper interactive browser tutorial.
Intro to Vyper interactive browser tutorial.
• OpenProofs - a library to create NFT badges. Similar to Gitcoin’s Kudos
OpenProofs - a library to create NFT badges. Similar to Gitcoin’s Kudos
• Why NuCypher decided to roll its own networking layer and not use devp2p/libp2p
Why NuCypher decided to roll its own networking layer and not use devp2p/libp2p
• Web 3 UX Kit from ConsenSys Design
Web 3 UX Kit from ConsenSys Design
• Austin Griffith’s example application that uses meta transactions for gasless tx. Status’ on gas
abstraction
Austin Griffith’s example application that uses meta transactions for gasless tx. Status’ on gas
Live on mainnet
• Create your decentralized organization live on the mainnet with Aragon v0.6. You can also apply as a
team for substantial funding to work fulltime on Aragon alongside the original team and the Giveth DAC
Create your decentralized organization live on the mainnet with Aragon v0.6. You can also apply as a
• Uniswap launches on mainnet. Written in Vyper, incredibly low gas costs, it’s a decentralized
Shapeshift/Bancor
Uniswap launches on mainnet. Written in Vyper, incredibly low gas costs, it’s a decentralized
Ecosystem
• Blockchains LLC ads blanketed Prague during Devcon. Here’s the video of the launch event . NYT’s
Nathaniel Popper on Blockchains launch. They’ve pledged to use the Ethereum main net
Blockchains LLC ads blanketed Prague during Devcon. Here’s the video of the launch event . NYT’s
• Lane Rettig’s ‘Twas the Night Before Devcon is impressive
Lane Rettig’s ‘Twas the Night Before Devcon is impressive
• Devcon4 was incredibly well organized. Thanks to that whole team.
Devcon4 was incredibly well organized. Thanks to that whole team.

• EthSimple : an ENS name for every address

• POA Network, Compound and ConsenSys announce Mana, a client implementation in Elixir running on
Beam, the Erlang VM. Github

the Erlang VM. Github
Enterprise
• Pantheon Java client from PegaSys is released. Why they built it - enterprise-grade under Apache 2
license, public chain compatible. with POA, IBFT v2 coming. Enterprise Alpha in Q1 2019
Pantheon Java client from PegaSys is released. Why they built it - enterprise-grade under Apache 2
• EEA releases Client Spec v2
EEA releases Client Spec v2
• The EEA releases Off-Chain Trusted Compute Specifications v0.5

• Microsoft releases eEVM : C++ implementation of the Ethereum Virtual Machine for enclaves/SGX
Microsoft releases eEVM : C++ implementation of the Ethereum Virtual Machine for enclaves/SGX
• EY implements zero knowledge on the public Ethereum chain
EY implements zero knowledge on the public Ethereum chain
Governance and Standards
• How to render the Melon protocol self-sustainable without the centralized company
How to render the Melon protocol self-sustainable without the centralized company
• There was an MIT piece that some BTC maxis misinterpreted as Vitalik leaving Ethereum . What most
people don’t understand is that Vitalik has been working for years to get himself left out of
decisions.
There was an MIT piece that some BTC maxis misinterpreted as Vitalik leaving Ethereum . What most
• ERC1537 : Auditable storage passing
ERC1537 : Auditable storage passing

Project Updates
• Augur is around 10k ETH in open interest and Maker nears 1m locked up ETH
Augur is around 10k ETH in open interest and Maker nears 1m locked up ETH

Augur dispute round analyzer

• Storj v3 whitepaper and first release of public alpha
Storj v3 whitepaper and first release of public alpha
• Cent evolves beyond bounties-only and incorporates posting/voting functionality similar to Steem
Cent evolves beyond bounties-only and incorporates posting/voting functionality similar to Steem
• Status deactivated their Slack on stage at Devcon and is now using Status.
Status deactivated their Slack on stage at Devcon and is now using Status.
• SingularDTV’s Prospect movie opens in theaters
SingularDTV’s Prospect movie opens in theaters
• OpenLaw Core - Javascript API, Scala shared library, OpenLaw virtual machine. OpenLaw also released
new tools for licensing, fractional ownership and royalties
OpenLaw Core - Javascript API, Scala shared library, OpenLaw virtual machine. OpenLaw also released

• CoinbasePro listed Brave’s BAT

importance of community in a basechain

• Tokenizing corporate stock by Gabe Shapiro
Tokenizing corporate stock by Gabe Shapiro

• Ziade: Token Ranked Lists

• Alex Tabarrok: When can TCRs actually work ?

General
• Not just Sergey Brin’s kid is mining Eth. Google CEO Sundai Pichai’s 11 year old son is also mining
for Eth. “I realized he understood Ethereum better than how paper money works.”
Not just Sergey Brin’s kid is mining Eth. Google CEO Sundai Pichai’s 11 year old son is also mining
• “ We are big believers in Ethereum ” - JP Morgan blockchain head Umar Farooq
“ We are big believers in Ethereum ” - JP Morgan blockchain head Umar Farooq
• William Shatner tweets about Ethereum.
William Shatner tweets about Ethereum.
• Two new block explorers: Blockchain.com and BTC.com
Two new block explorers: Blockchain.com and BTC.com
• Ethereum Foundation donates 15k ETC to the ETC Coop . The Peacebridge is funded and ETC’s Mantis
client will support ETH.
Ethereum Foundation donates 15k ETC to the ETC Coop . The Peacebridge is funded and ETC’s Mantis
• ConsenSys acquires asteroid mining company Planetary Resources.
ConsenSys acquires asteroid mining company Planetary Resources.
• BlockReduce - Karl Kreder’s paper on a scaling through hierachical merge-mined chains
BlockReduce - Karl Kreder’s paper on a scaling through hierachical merge-mined chains
• EOS Diligence Report - as Owocki puts it EOS has “misrepresent[ed] TX/sec nos, calling it a
blockchain when no cryptographic verification or immutability”
EOS Diligence Report - as Owocki puts it EOS has “misrepresent[ed] TX/sec nos, calling it a blockchain
when no cryptographic verification or immutability”
• ZCash’s Sapling release activated without problems
ZCash’s Sapling release activated without problems
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new additions in bold):
• Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Dec 7-9 - ETHSingapore hackathon (ETHGlobal)
• Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
Jan 10 - Mobi Grand Challenge hackathon ends
• Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
Jan 29-30 - AraCon (Berlin)
• Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
Feb 7-8 - Melonport’s M1 conf (Zug)
• Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
Feb 15-17 - ETHDenver hackathon (ETHGlobal)
• Feb 23-25 - EthAustin hackathon (EthUniversal)
Feb 23-25 - EthAustin hackathon (EthUniversal)
If you appreciate this newsletter, thank ConsenSys
This newsletter is made possible by ConsenSys , which is perpetually hiring if you’re interested.
I own Week In Ethereum. As such, editorial control has always been 100% me. If you’re unhappy with
editorial decisions, feel free to tweet at me.
Housekeeping
Note : This issue came out a bit late. Devcon issue is hard, even when you skip Prague sightseeing and
lock yourself in a hotel room.
Most of what I link to I tweet first: @evan_van_ness
